Posted By: ttian (3/24/2009 8:46:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is selling at between 150-200$ and my question is why? Just how rare are these cards? if you search it on eBay, there are at liest a dozen of them for sale, and although it cannot be removed from the game or kept dead, it can be killed, and it costs high mana to cast. there are several cards from three kingdoms that are "big money" cards, for the price of this one, a person could get a time twister, and for the price of the imperial seal a person could buy a mox, which *I would say* is way more useful and is probably a better investment, Moxxen have proven thier value over time, what about these cards? now before someone jumps on here and says i am jelous becouse i don't have one or can't afford one, i do have this card, it is being graded right now, it got sent in with my Black lotus.

Posted By: wgillespie (7/14/2009 9:00:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: it's selling at $200 because portal three kingdoms was never released in the US making these cards extremely hard to come by it's only at $200 dollars now because it's not nearly as useful as a black lotus it's just the rarest dragon on the face of the earth and I like alot of people who play this type of game (Fantasy RPG-ISH or RPG games) enjoy Dragons and see them as the ultimate power in whatever plane they happen to be on and they collect them. i have a dragon collection not merely limited to cards and i would love a Zodiac Dragon, would I pay $200 for it? no. would people with $200 to spare do it? probably, would someone with a lotus collection like a black lotus? yes. spend 2-3k on it? no. if they had 2-3K spare change? probably. i rest my case. Dragon Collected with large purses drive the price up and the 2-3 thousand people who have these still in any condition to sell name the price i respectfully end my argument, good day sir

Dragon Collected with large purses drive the price up and the 2-3 thousand people who have these still in any condition to sell name the price i respectfully end my argument, good day sir

posts.post_content: It doesnt even have flying... When I think of a big fatty dragon, the first, VERY FIRST thing that comes to mind is flying. So... this thing is horrible, collecters may like it for the reasons already given... that's why its worth money, doesnt mean it's not horrible.
